context.p: A splash screen is the first evidence that an application is running. It says something about the product and remains visible until the application is ready to use.

case.title: Activation

context.p: When the application is not running

case.step:
Invoke the application via the explorer or Windows Start menu.
Almost immediately, the "splash screen" appears, showing the application title, a graphic logo, a copyright notice, and a status message that tells what's going on, such as "Loading project X"
The splash screen remains until the application window is ready to use; within 30 seconds.
The application title bar should appear, preceded by the name of a language project if applicable. A hyphen separates the former from the latter if both are present.
